message: Open for name suggestions too as someone created an extension with name "Readable HackerNews" already
Overall its looks very nice. God know HN needs a revamp in readability. :) A few points though
you mean up vote on comments or the posts?
Uups, posted the same twice. Here's the front page: http://cl.ly/132L1x1a3L0x1r1R2b3u
I still need to package it and upload to Chrome Store but I need a name first :/
I'm in the works of creating a Readability like plugin CSS extension for HN and would love to get some feedback: http://cl.ly/3h0n2z092m331p2D1K2Y & http://cl.ly/132L1x1a3L0x1r1R2b3u
Agree with 1 and will most likely do it. If you happen to have upvote rights I would really appreciate a html dump to get styling right
Sorry, meant down vote
1. The voting widgets could be a bit bigger. Will help a lot
It looks very good. Can it be installed as of now?
2. Possibility of configurable fonts or may be some way of adding custom styles would be great. E.g I want to use a font that I find more readable.
Ah. sorry.  I do not have down vote right
http://scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site_id=nrsi&item_id=Gentium_download
I think I'll stick with Readability's font-family. I can share the code for you if you want to modify it
Yeah, I'll get back to you on that
For the second: For now I don't have interest to make it configurable but if you have suggestions for a better replacement I'm all ears (as long as it's serif ;)
I love Gentium
That could also work. I mean if its open source then not much of a problem.

On the other hand if its not much of work then you can probably add a option where user can select from a list of font families, of course assuming  those fonts are installed on their systems. It will hep in case of non Mac systems. Not all fonts from Mac are available on Linux and others.
@mirnazim https://github.com/jorde/readable-hn
Installed it, looks really good. Thanks!
Here's another one: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/ofjfdfaleomlfanfehgblppafkijjhmi Looks more finished than mine, truth to be told
